title: Trump Seeks Murdoch Deposition in Epstein Defamation Case
description: On July 28, 2025, Donald Trump requested a federal court to order Rupert Murdoch\'s deposition within 15 days in his defamation lawsuit against the Wall Street Journal. Trump alleges the Journal published a false article about him and seeks $10 billion in damages. Murdoch has not publicly responded.

title: Trump Imposes New Tariffs, Markets React
description: On August 1, 2025, President Trump signed an executive order imposing new tariffs ranging from 10% to 41% on imports from various countries, including India, Taiwan, and Canada. The announcement led to declines in Asian, U.S., and European stock futures, reflecting investor anxiety over rising global trade tensions.

title: Global Trade Partners Rush to Secure Deals Amid Tariff Deadline
description: As the August 1 deadline approaches, U.S. trading partners, including Canada, Mexico, and India, have urgently dispatched officials to Washington to negotiate last-minute trade agreements with President Trump\'s administration. The new tariffs, up to 50%, aim to reduce trade deficits and exert political pressure.

title: Musk\'s erratic June included a $15 million peace offering
description: In June 2025, Elon Musk publicly criticized President Trump\'s fiscal policies and called for his impeachment. He later reconciled, deleted his posts, and donated $15 million to pro-Trump and Republican congressional super PACs, signaling a shift in his political stance.

title: Department of Education Initiates Major Staff Reductions Amid Restructuring
description: The Department of Education announced a reduction in force affecting nearly half of its staff, including significant cuts to the Office for Civil Rights. This move is part of a broader effort to restructure the department and has raised concerns about the future of civil rights investigations and educational equity.

title: DHS Announces Termination of Greenhouse Gas Reduction Fund Grants
description: EPA Administrator Lee Zeldin announced the termination of grants in two Greenhouse Gas Reduction Fund programs: the National Clean Investment Fund and the Clean Communities Investment Accelerator. This action is part of a broader effort to freeze federal climate-related grant and loan programs, posing challenges to clean energy projects, especially in low-income communities.

title: Fighting Oligarchy Tour Continues Across U.S.
description: Senator Bernie Sanders and Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez are leading the \'Fighting Oligarchy Tour,\' a series of political rallies aimed at opposing corporate influence in politics. The tour has drawn large crowds and focuses on issues like income disparity and democratic integrity.

title: Proposal to End Foreign-Influenced Corporate Spending in U.S. Elections
description: The Center for American Progress recommends enacting laws to prevent foreign-influenced U.S. corporations from spending money in federal or state elections. The proposal includes specific ownership thresholds to identify foreign influence and aims to protect the integrity of U.S. elections.

title: Nevada Passes Law Mandating AI Disclosure in Campaign Ads
description: Nevada\'s governor signed a bill requiring all campaign ads that include AI or manipulated media to include a disclaimer stating that the ad has been manipulated by AI. The law aims to address concerns over the use of AI in political advertising and will take effect on January 1, 2026.
